intro: Strychnos froesii, commonly known as the African starfruit tree, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, star-shaped fruits that are typically yellow or orange when mature. It is often found in open woodlands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal uses, it is sometimes cultivated in horticultural settings.
